Description: Black steatite scarab (only partly worked) engraved with a winged sphinx wearing the crowns of Upper and Lower Egypt, or else a griffin, detail very worn; very schematic anatomical details on the scarab back; perforated longitudinally for suspension.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: Reyes 2001, p. 106 suggests that the partially worked state of the gem indicates local production rather than a Phoenician import.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (289)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 124, Tomb 242; p. 99. Fig.147.30)
Reyes 2001 / The stamp-seals of ancient Cyprus (No. 214, p. 106 & fig. 234)
